intro: Conostylis caricina, commonly known as the narrow-leaf conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and inland regions. Conostylis caricina is often found in open habitats such as heathlands and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
